definition: inconvenient/troublesome/annoying/to trouble or bother sb/to put sb to trouble
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience

sentences.english: Hunting without a license will land you in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 无证狩猎将会使你陷入麻烦。

sentences.english: Trouble develops, however, when any human instinct or appetite causes overdeveloped.
sentences.chinese: 但假使人的欲求或喜好过度膨胀则会带来麻烦。

sentences.english: Most administrators think of paging as something that is onerous.
sentences.chinese: 大多数管理员都认为分页是一件很麻烦的事情。

sentences.english: Why she’s a spicy dish: Shilpa has the best of intentions but trouble always seems to find her.
sentences.chinese: 希尔帕虽是一片好心，但麻烦总是找上她。

sentences.english: He has had a bit of trouble, and I have to straighten it out for him.
sentences.chinese: 他遇到了点儿麻烦，我得替他把这事了结掉。

sentences.english: From that day forward he never bothered me again.
sentences.chinese: 从那天起，他再也没找过我的麻烦。

sentences.english: Julia is afraid she will embarrass herself and the whole team.
sentences.chinese: 茱丽雅害怕自己将舞蹈队带来麻烦甚至搞砸。

sentences.english: The Box Hill line, causing trouble for Zhao Yingxiong.
sentences.chinese: 匣子上山一行，为赵英雄带来了麻烦。

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, when I have trouble, I always ask her for advice.
sentences.chinese: 跟你说老实话，每当我有麻烦时总向她征求意见。

sentences.english: At once I stood up and said it was too inconvenient, I then walked quickly to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 我立即起身说那太麻烦了，就疾步跟过去。

sentences.english: much to worry about; they always make trouble for you.
sentences.chinese: 事要操心，还老是惹麻烦给你。

sentences.english: That means you will have a little bit of trig to do in the integral.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着，在积分的时候会遇到一点小麻烦。

sentences.english: I will answer for it that we shall find no inconvenience from narrow roads on Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 我敢保险，礼拜三我们不会因为路窄遇到什么麻烦。

sentences.english: John and Jack went through many troubles together to become foul weather friends.
sentences.chinese: 约翰和杰克经历了许多麻烦，一起成为患难之交。

sentences.english: I've caused much bother by lossing my ticket.
sentences.chinese: 我因为丢了票引起了很多麻烦。

sentences.english: 14-8 And trouble for me it'll be, fighting every day until I die.
sentences.chinese: 我的麻烦是每天奋斗直到生命结束。

definition: to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
when the moment comes/at that time
convenient/suitable/to facilitate/to make things easy/having money to spare/(euphemism) to relieve oneself
to omit/to dispense with/to make unnecesary/to save (time, trouble etc)
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
